CatDescriptText: Mrs. Viola Finch, housewife,1843 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think waitresses should be paid a minimum of $1 per hour plus tips?" answer reads: "Yes, I think they should get the $1 an hour minimum salary. I know many of them are abused and come in contact with many unpleasant things.  They earn anything they can get."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Viola Finch, wearing floral dress with light colored collar and cuffs, standing on sidewalk next to baskets on street with bus and buildings in background
